data.title: Ed Noyes on LinkedIn: Felix Hoffmann
data.meta_description: Felix Hoffmann (b. 1/21/1868)  a German chemist, who first synthesized medically useful forms of heroin and aspirin. He was born in Ludwigsburg and studied…
data.text:
𝗧𝗼𝗽 𝟮𝟬𝟬 𝗕𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗡𝗮𝗺𝗲 𝗗𝗿𝘂𝗴𝘀 𝗯𝘆 𝗥𝗲𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗹 𝗦𝗮𝗹𝗲𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟯 Another year has gone by and Ryan E. Williams and Hayden M. Leatherwood from Jon Njardarson Group. In my opinion the most insightful overview on the top drugs available and in poster form! In 2023 Keytruda (Pembroluzimab) was the best selling drug with 25 Billion in Sales. Ozempic (Semaglutide) already 3rd best selling drug in 2023 - let's see what happens in 2024. .You can get all the posters and high resolution versions here: https://lnkd.in/e7TyWAGd 𝗠𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗴𝗲 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗮𝘂𝘁𝗵𝗼𝗿𝘀 TOP 200 DRUGS (2006-present): As part of our efforts to educate students about how chemistry positively impacts our lives, my research group has created the pharmaceutical posters shown below, which can be downloaded for free as high resolution PDF files from our website. We envisioned that this attractive graphical information would be a useful tool for teaching both undergraduate and graduate students in addition to serving as a spring board of ideas for researchers interested in the development of new synthetic methods and strategies. I hope everyone enjoys these posters as much as we have and I encourage all visitors to download them and use for teaching, fun chemical browsing, research purposes or even as an attractive and accessible graphical summary to help communicate to the public the critical role organic chemistry plays in the development of new medicines. New posters are completed and posted late spring or early summer every year. (Please e-mail us any mistakes you come across and we will make sure to correct them promptly). Part of material is based upon work supported by the National Science Foundation under Grants No. 0848324,1266365, 1565500, 1857708 and now 2153657. Please contact us directly if you need higher resolution PDF files than those presented on this website Please cite J. Chem. Ed. 2010, 87, 1348 when referencing the posters.

📢My first Review Article has been published in the prestigious journal of GSC Biological and Pharmaceutical Sciences🎉 Titled "A review: Pharmacological and phytochemical update of Passiflora edulis F. Flavicarpa" 🔗Paper URL: https://lnkd.in/eHmpGQbC 🎓Guide: Sonam Bisem Ma'am, Suraj yadav Sir 👥Co-Authors: Jagruti Wadatkar, Dnyaeshwari Sakhare 📊Published in Volume: Volume 27 | Issue 2 | 2024, Page no: 143-153 💡Impact factor: 6.25 🔬Through a comprehensive review of existing literature, my co-authors and I have highlighted the various bioactive compounds present in Passiflora edulis F. Flavicarpa such as flavonoids, alkaloids, and phenolic acids. These compounds have shown promising results in treating various ailments.. 📚I hope this review article will serve as a valuable resource for researchers and healthcare professionals. Thank you to my co-authors and the journal for making this possible...💫 #Grateful #Research #HealthcareProfessionals #PhytochemicalPhenomenon #MedicinalMarvels #PassionForPharmacology #PublishedAuthor 🚀

I'm so happy to have successfully defended my undergraduate research work today (19th January, 2024) on the topic: Synthesis of 8-methoxyquinoline-5-sulfonyl proline. Below is the summary of the research: During this research, I was able to work on the synthesis and characterization of 8-methoxyquinoline-5-sulfonyl proline, a derivative of quinoline. Quinoline and its derivatives have attracted significant attention due to their diverse biological activities, including anticancer, antimalarial, and anti-inflammatory properties. Though I faced numerous challenges in the process of this research work but in the long run I was able to synthesize the compound of interest through series of chemical reactions involving, 8-hydroxyquinoline, 8-methoxyquinoline, and 8-methoxyquinoline-5-sulfonyl chloride. The experiment began with the synthesis of 8-methoxyquinoline which was achieved through simple alkylation of 8-hydroxyquinoline using methyl iodide as the alkylating agent. The resulting 8-methoxyquinoline was then subjected to sulfonylation using sulfonyl chloride to produce 8-methoxyquinoline-5-sulfonyl chloride. The 8-methoxyquinoline-5-sulfonyl chloride obtained was then treated with proline, an imino acid in the presence of hydrochloric acid which lead to the synthesis of the compound of interest. Other chemical reagents subsequently used during the synthesis were acetone, chloroform, potassium carbonate, calcium chloride, and chlorosulfonic acid. And the processes involved were distillation, color chromatography, reflux among other processes. Finally, the synthesized 8-methoxyquinoline-5-sulfunyl proline was evaluated for its biological activities and potential pharmaceutical applications in material science. Thanks to my supervisor, Prof. B.J Owolabi. I couldn't have achieved this without his guidance.
